experience: You and Robert both know Aric Zion, Dustin Faultner, SPHR (L.I.O.N.), and 45 others

Direct Energy is one of North America's largest energy and energy-related services providers. We provide choice and support in managing energy use and costs through our portfolio of innovative products and services.•Brought in to oversee the hiring at Direct Energy's first in-sourced Contact Center. Responsible for growth from 70 employees to +500 agents, leadership, and professional support staff•Promoted to oversee hiring of COO division and all Contact Center recruitment for Direct Energy•Provide recruitment support for +2,000 positions, both internal, external and contractor•Oversee quality hiring initiatives with Contact Center Vendors (BPOs) in US, Costa RIca, Guatamala•Manage a national team of 6, supporting three Direct Energy locations in North America. (Phoenix, Tulsa, Chicago). •Lead staffing projects to continuously improve staffing processes and vendor relationships•Implemented site wide behavioral and cognitive agility tools to directly impact quality of hire and increase ramp to production times for new hires. •Proactively build and maintain  new and existing sourcing avenues for contact center and professional hiring•Support multiple stakeholders across Residential, Services and Commercial lines of business•Ensure flawless data integrity in the recruiting management system•Coordinate, participate and/or support multiple HR, Talent Acquisition and Operations projects across multiple lines of business

•Brought in as the first Staffing Specialist to manage growth of Phoenix location. Successfully grew Phoenix location from 16 employees to 1200. •Responsible for managing the full-cycle recruitment process for Phoenix locations, which consist of over 1,700 employees in 3 different operational capacities.•Oversaw the hiring of management through executive level openings. •Supervised daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly activity for all recruiters to ensure quotas were met and quality of hire remained acceptable. •Coordinated quarterly evaluations to ensure process efficiency. •Collect and analyzed data to evaluate effectiveness in lowering attrition and increasing employee loyalty and performance.•Interface with executive management, human resources, and hiring managers in order to foster a collaborative working environment to accomplish common goals.  •Developed, designed and implemented social media sites. Worked with web design and marketing teams to build a network of sites that increased internal referral/applicant pools by 23% over a 2-month time span. •Developed internal tracking of all new hires from being sourced, interviewed, and hired that all successfully complete 30-60-90 day milestones to provide valid data that evaluates our overall process and ensure the right “profile” of candidates are being hired.  •Re-vamped full-cycle recruitment guide to create a more efficient process from the sourcing, applicant assessment, recruiter pre screens, background checks, in person interviews, salary negotiations, and on-boarding.•Responsible for fostering client relationships in effort to maintain a correct forecast of departmental backfill and growth.•Re-negotiated contracts with sourcing vendors including, but not limited to Jobing.com, CareerBuilder, Monster and various job fair agencies. Also, increased exposure by searching out and posting on free jobsites, which resulted in a lower cost per hire (CPH).

•Hired to assist in the opening of Phoenix office. Successfully staffed call center from 12 to 264 employees in 9 months while maintaining a 64% retention rate. •Developed and managed full-cycle recruitment process that was later adopted by the New Jersey home office. Process included guidelines for sourcing, pre screens, behavioral interviewing, panel interviewing, assessment criteria/implementation, background checks, salary negotiation and hiring decisions. •Interfaced with senior management to identify the projected needs of the operations floor to ensure needs were met in a timely manner. •Responsible for the HR on boarding functions for PHX location consisting of all new hire paperwork (I-9, benefits, tax forms, payroll, state and national licensing, etc..)•Managed team of two recruiters. Responsible for overall management and oversight of recruitment campaigns. Set daily/weekly/monthly goals to ensure needs were met. Provided coaching and feedback on a daily/weekly basis.
